definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue

sentences.english: The office looked like a kangaroo court.
sentences.chinese: 这间办公室看起来像是一个私设的公堂。

sentences.english: Be less than two years unexpectedly, both sides litigates.
sentences.chinese: 不料不到两年，双方就对簿公堂。

sentences.english: They pledged to challenge the rectors in court.
sentences.chinese: 他们誓言和校长到法院对簿公堂。

sentences.english: They need to be cherished byentertainment companies, not sued.
sentences.chinese: 娱乐公司应该珍惜它们，而非将其告上公堂。

sentences.english: 16So he had them ejected from the court.

definition: to confront sb with accusation/written charge in court (in former times)/to take sb to court
to open a law court/to set up a mourning hall
to report a case to the authorities (old)
